isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - FE 300, RE 200, RE 300 - RE 200/RE 300 ELECTRONIC ENGINES - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcprocinfo.para: Before beginning these test procedures, do the following:

item.para: Make sure the vehicle batteries are at 75% state of charge (SOC) or higher. This represents an open circuit voltage (OCV) of 12.4 volts. Batteries with an OCV of 12 volts or less are either completely discharged or have a dead cell.
Check any light or indicator lamp filaments that are suspected of being open (burned out). This is done to avoid unnecessary extensive circuit checks.
Inspect all connectors for loose or damaged pins, wires, etc. Refer to TEST EQUIPMENT AND CONNECTOR REPAIR section in GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the Master Service Manual.

When the technician determines that a fuse is blown, while checking its condition, he is directed to locate the cause of the overload condition and to repair it. While no further instruction on this procedure is listed in the diagnostic tables, the common procedure is as follows: isolate sections of the circuit by disconnecting connectors, and measure the resistance to ground to find the circuit that is shorted to ground. Then locate the damaged spot in the wire or connector and repair.

Diagnostics for circuits that are malfunctioning by sticking in the on position are generally not covered in detail. It is assumed that the technician knows to check for a malfunctioning switch, relay, or solenoid.

svcsubproc.title: ATA Data Link and Diagnostic/ Programming Connector

table.title: ATA Data Link and Diagnostic/ Programming Connector

entry.para: At ATA connector (384), measure voltage from cavity B circuit A97C to ground.
Check fuse F6 for open condition. If okay, locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A97C, then repair.
Disconnect ECM2 connector (6021) and install jumper wires from cavity 20 circuit A98A(+) and cavity 21 circuit A98C(-) to ground.
At (384) measure resistance of circuits A98B(+)/A98A(+) and A98A(+) to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits A98B(+)/ A98A(+) and A98A(+) or dash conn. (3), then repair.
At (384) measure resistance of circuits A98D(-)/A98C(-) and A98C(-) to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits A98D(-)/A98C(-) and A98C(-) or dash conn. (3), then repair.
Remove jumpers and reconnect (6021). Disconnect IDM2 connector (6011) and install jumper wires from cavity 2 circuit A98AA(+) and cavity 3 circuit A98CA(-) to ground.
At (384) measure resistance of circuits A98B(+)/A98A(+) and A98AA(+) to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits A98B(+)/ A98A(+) and A98AA(+) or dash conn. (6000), then repair.
At (384) measure resistance of circuits A98D(-)/A98C(-) and A98CA(-) to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits A98D(-)/A98C(-) and A98CA(-) or dash conn. (6000), then repair.
Remove jumpers and reconnect (6011). Disconnect cluster connector (11) and install jumper wires from cavity 7 circuit A98E(+) and cavity 9 circuit A98F(-) to ground.
At (384) measure resistance of circuit A98B(+)/A98E(+) to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A98B(+)/ A98E(+), then repair.
At (384) measure resistance of circuits A98D(-)/A98F(-) to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A98D(-)/ A98F(-), then repair.
Reconnect (27). At ATA interface connector (374), measure resistance from circuit 98H(+) to (384) circuit 98B(+).
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 98B(+)/ 98H(+), then repair.
At ATA interface connector (374), measure resistance from circuit A98G(-) to (384) circuit A98D(-).
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A98D(-)/ A98G(-), then repair.
Data communication link circuitry checks good. If condition persists, refer to Engine Diagnostic Manual.

svcsubproc.title: ECM Power and Ground System Circuitry

table.title: ECM Power and Ground System Circuitry

entry.para: Remove 40A power module maxifuse (1C-A) and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse holder, measure voltage from circuit 14A to ground. Re-install fuse.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14A, then repair or replace cable assembly.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At 1B-B4 fuse cavity A, measure voltage from circuit V97HB to ground.
Refer to 12 Volt Power Distribution (Battery) in Section 1.
Check fuse F40 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At F40 fuse cavity A, measure voltage from circuit V97LD to ground.
F40, cav. A, V97LD to gnd.
Refer to 12 Volt Power Distribution (Battery) in Section 1.
Check fuse F12 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At F12 fuse cavity A, measure voltage from circuit A13 to ground.
F12, cav. A, A13 to gnd.
Refer to 12 Volt Power Distribution (Key Switch) in Section 1.
Disconnect ECM2 connector (6020) and measure resistance of circuits at harness cavities 6 and 7 to ground.
Disconnect IDM2 connector (6011) and measure resistance of circuits at harness cavity 1 to ground.
Disconnect engine harness/ negative battery cable connector (665). At cable cavity A, measure resistance of circuit 11-G to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-G, then repair or replace cable assembly.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits 11-G/K97-GV, 11-G/K97-GW, or 11-G/K97-GA, then repair.
At (6020) harness cavity 3, measure voltage from circuit K97UA to ground.
At (6011) harness cavity 9, measure voltage from circuit K97UB to ground.
Disconnect dash connector (6000). Turn key on and at cavity 15, measure voltage from circuit K97CR to ground.
Repair K97C/K97UA or K97C/K97UB between (3) and (6020) or (6011).
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit K97CR, then repair.
At (6020), measure voltage from harness cavity 5 circuit V97J to ground.
Remove ECM power relay (6005). At socket cavity 8B, measure voltage from circuit V97JA to ground.
Disconnect dash connector (412). At cavity A, measure voltage from circuit 14B/N97JA to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14B, then repair.
Measure resistance of circuit V97J between relay (6005), socket cavity 6C, and ECM2 connector (6020), cavity 5.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit N97JA, then repair.
At (6021) measure voltage from harness cavities 1, 2, and at (6011) cavity 10 to ground.
Remove ECM power relay (6005). At socket cavity 6B, measure voltage from circuit V97HB, fuse 1B-B4, and V97HA to ground.
(6005), cav. 6B, V97HB, 1B-B4 and V97HA to gnd.
Disconnect positive battery/ engine harness connector (412) and at circuit 14B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14B, then repair.
Measure resistance of circuits between relay (6005), socket cavity 8C, and ECM2 connector (6021), cavities 1, 2, and IDM2 connector (6011), cavity 10.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits V97TA/V97CL, V97TA/V97CK, or V97TA/V97AL, then repair.
At (6011), measure voltage from harness cavity 8 circuit V97LA to ground.
Remove IDM power relay (6006). At socket cavity 8B, measure voltage from circuit V97LB to ground.
Disconnect dash connector (412). At cavity A, measure voltage from circuit V97LB to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14B, then repair.
Measure resistance of circuit V97LA between relay (6006, socket cavity 6C, and IDM2 connector (6011), cavity 8.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit V97LB, then repair.
At (6011) measure voltage from harness cavities 6 and 12 to ground.
Remove IDM power relay (6006). At socket cavity 6B, measure voltage from circuit V97TC to ground.
Disconnect positive battery/ engine harness connector (412) and at circuit 14B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14B, then repair.
Measure resistance of circuits between relay (6006), socket cavity 8C, and IDM2 connector (6011), cavities 6 and 12.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits V97TA/V97Y, V97TA/V97LD, or V97TA, 1B-B4 and V97LC, then repair.
Reconnect connectors. Power module and ground system circuits check good. Should condition persist, refer to Engine Diagnostics Manual for ECM2 diagnostics.

svcsubproc.title: Accelerator (APS/IVS), Barometric Air Pressure (BAP), and Ambient Air Temperature Sensor (ATS) Systems

table.title: Accelerator (APS/IVS), Barometric Air Pressure (BAP), and Ambient Air Temperature Sensor (ATS) Systems

entry.para: Is a fault code present for APS/IVS sensor/switch?
Check circuit breaker F25 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace circuit breaker.
Disconnect APS/IVS conn. (382) and at cavity F, measure voltage from circuit A99E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A99E, then repair.
At (382), install jumper from cavity A, circuit A99B to ground. Disconnect ECM2 connector (6021). At cavity 18, measure resistance from circuit A99B to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A99B or dash conn. (9851), then repair.
At (382), move jumper to cavity B, circuit A99A and ground. At (6021) cavity 24, measure resistance of circuit K97W to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit K97W, dash conn. (3), or circuit K97W/K99A, then repair.
At (382), move jumper to cavity C, circuit A99J and ground. At (6021) cavity 4, measure resistance of circuit A99C to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A99C, dash conn. (3), or circuit A99C/A99J, then repair.
At (382), move jumper to cavity D, circuit A99D and ground. At (6021) cavity 12, measure resistance of circuit A99D to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A99D, or dash conn. (9851), then repair.
Remove jumper and reconnect connectors. APS/IVS circuits check good. Is problem corrected?
Replace APS/IVS. If problem persists, refer to Engine Diagnostic Manual for ECM2 diagnostics.
Is a fault code present for BAP sensor?
Disconnect BAP sensor connector (6702). Install jumper wire from cavity 1, circuit K97Z to ground. Disconnect ECM2 connector. (6021). At cavity 24, measure resistance of circuit K97W to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit K97W, dash conn. (6000), or circuit K97W, then repair.
At (6702), move jumper wire to cavity 2, circuit K97BL and ground. At (6021) cavity 4, measure resistance of circuit K99C to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A99C, dash conn. (6000), or circuit K99C/K97BL, then repair.
At (437), move jumper wire to cavity 3, circuit K97CD and ground. At (6020) cavity 24, measure resistance of circuit K97CD to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit K97CD or dash conn. (6000), then repair.
Remove jumper and reconnect connectors. BAP system circuits check good. Is problem corrected?
Replace BAP sensor. If problem persists, refer to Engine Diagnostic Manual for ECM2 diagnostics.
Is a fault code present for the ATS system?
Disconnect ATS connector (6703). Install jumper wire from cavity B, circuit K97AX to ground. Disconnect IDM2 connector (6011). At cavity 5, measure resistance from circuit K97AX to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit K97AX, then repair.
At (6703), move jumper to cavity A, circuit K97BU and ground. At (6021) cavity 24, measure resistance of circuit K97W to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit K97W/ K97BU, then repair.
Remove jumper and reconnect connectors. ATS system circuits check good. Is problem corrected?
Replace ATS. If problem persists, refer to Engine Diagnostic Manual for ECM2 diagnostics.
Are both the engine (0x00) and the MSM (aka ESC) on the Datalink?
Does the input in MD change with the switch changes?
Does the input in MD change with the switch changes?
MSM is functioning properly. Check that cruise control is enabled in the engine controller
1. Verify Cruise ON/OFF switch and wiring, OFF state
Is pin 8 open to ignition when switch is OFF?
Repair wiring or switch, and retest
1. Verify Cruise ON/OFF switch and wiring, ON state
Is pin 8 shorted to ignition when switch is ON?
Repair wiring or switch, and retest
1. Verify Cruise SET/RES switch and wiring, normal state
Is pin 9 open to ground and ignition when switch is not pressed?
Repair wiring or switch, and retest
1. Verify Cruise SET/RES switch and wiring, RESUME state
Is pin 9 shorted to ground when switch is moved to RESUME?
Repair wiring or switch, and retest
1. Verify Cruise SET/RES switch and wiring, SET state
2. Turn Cruise ON/OFF switch to ON
Is pin 9 shorted to ignition when switch is moved to SET?
Repair wiring or switch, and retest
Is the engine (0x00) on the Datalink?
3. Measure resistance across datalink pins in wiring harness
2. Measure the voltage at the MSM's harness ignition pin
1. Measure the resistance between the MSM's harness ground pin and ground
Is the resistance less than 10 ohms?
Is the MSM (aka ESC) on the Datalink?
Check the engine's power connections and data link wiring.
Remove circuit breaker F12. and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse holder, measure voltage from circuit A14 to ground. Re-install fuse.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuits N14A-FL/N14-FL, dash conn. (2), or circuit A14, then repair or replace cable assembly.
Disconnect MSM connector (3115). Turn key and cruise switch (391) on. At (3115), measure voltage from circuit A97CF cavity 8 to ground.
Disconnect cruise on/off switch (391) and with switch in on position, measure resistance across terminals.
At Brake/Cruise Interface Relay connector (1133), measure voltage from circuit A97B to ground. Reconnect connectors.
Repair open or poor con- nection in circuit A97B.
Check open circuit breaker F23. If okay, locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A97B, then repair.
With on/off switch on and set/resume switch held in set position, measure voltage at MSM connector (3115) from circuit 97DE cavity 9 to ground.
Disconnect cruise set/resume switch (392). With switch held in set position, measure resistance across terminals 1 to 2.
With on/off switch on and at connector (392), measure voltage from circuit A97DH to ground. Reconnect connectors.
Repair open in cir. A97DH or A97CA .
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A97CA, then repair.
With on/off switch on and set/resume switch held in resume position, measure voltage at MSM connector (3115) from circuit A97DE cavity 9 to ground.
Disconnect cruise set/resume switch (392). With switch held in resume position, measure resistance across terminals 2 to 3. Reconnect connectors.
Repair open in cir. A97-GE, A97-GJ A97DE, or poor con- nection to Cab ground.
Is the vehicle equipped with remote engine controls?
Reconnect connectors. Cruise control circuitry checks good. If condition persists, refer to Engine Diagnostic Manuals for ECM2 diagnostics.
